meanings.definition: A tax on goods produced for sale within a country
meanings.sent1: The excise on imported goods helps support the local economy.
meanings.sent2: The government collects excise to fund public services.
meanings.sent3: Paying excise is like giving a small gift to your country.
meanings.sent4: The excise acts as a financial barrier for foreign products.
meanings.sent5: The excise is like a toll booth on the road to economic growth.

meanings.sent1: The surgeon had to excise the tumor to save the patient's life.
meanings.sent2: She used scissors to excise the unwanted fabric from the dress.
meanings.sent3: He decided to excise the bad memories from his mind like cutting out a paper snowflake.
meanings.sent4: She excised the toxic relationship from her life, feeling lighter and free.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to excise the dead branches to help the tree thrive.

meanings.definition: To impose an excise tax on
meanings.sent1: The government decided to excise a tax on luxury items.
meanings.sent2: They excised a surcharge on imported electronics to protect local manufacturers.
meanings.sent3: The decision to excise a tax on sugary drinks caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: The new law will excise a levy on carbon emissions to promote environmental awareness.
meanings.sent5: The company had to excise additional charges on their products due to new regulations.
